Description: Round-topped limestone stela with incised detail divided into three registers: 1 - Male figure before Osiris and Isis. 2 - Ibis-headed figure before a bull; Carian text above. 3 - Deceased woman on couch with mourners.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Curator's comments: Emery, W. B. “Preliminary Report on the Excavations at North Saqqâra, 1968-9.” The Journal of Egyptian Archaeology, vol. 56, Egypt Exploration Society, 1970, p. 6, pl. X

To be included in the 'Musee achemenide virtuel et interactif' (see www.achemenet.com). Published in: S. Davies, The sacred animal necropolis at North Saqqara. The mother of Apis and baboon catacombs, MEES 76, 2006, p. 95, pl. XLVIa
See Masson, O., Carian Inscriptions from North Saqqara and Buhen, London, EES 1978, p. 22-3 and 70ff and pls. IV.1; XXXIII,1.
Bibliographic references: Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (fig. 71)
Frankfurt 2005 / Ägypten, Griechenland, Rom : Abwehr und Berührung ; Städelsches Kunstinstitut und Städtische Galerie, 26. November 2005 - 26. Februar 2006 (no.38)
Exhibition history: 2006-2007, Frankfurt, Museum Alter Plastic, Egypt, Greece and Rome 2016, 19 May-27 Nov, BM exhibition Sunken Cities 2018 27 Mar-9 Sep, Los Angeles, Getty Centre, Egypt-Greece-Rome: Cultures in Contact 2022 27 April – 25 July, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Pharaoh of the Two Lands 2022-2023 15 Oct - Feb, London, BM, 4 Lives, G4
Condition: good; extensive traces of ancient painting, most of them not visible to the naked eye.
